parts.text: {"word":"rigidifier","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"A substance or device that makes something rigid or more rigid.","english_definition":"A substance or device that makes something rigid or more rigid.","examples":[{"sentence":"The composite material was treated with a rigidifier to increase its structural integrity.","translation":"複合材料は、構造的完全性を高めるために硬化剤で処理されました。"},{"sentence":"The inflatable structure required a rigidifier to maintain its shape under pressure.","translation":"膨張式構造物は、圧力下で形状を維持するために硬化剤を必要としました。"}],"synonyms":["stiffener","hardener","solidifier"],"antonyms":["softener","plasticizer"],"related_words":["rigid","rigidification","rigidify"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Derived from the verb 'rigidify', which comes from 'rigid' + '-ify' (to make).","note":"The word follows a standard pattern of word formation in English, where '-ify' is added to an adjective to create a verb meaning 'to make [adjective]'. Then, '-er' is added to the verb to form a noun denoting something that performs the action of the verb."},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/rɪˈdʒɪdəˌfaɪər/","syllables":"ri-gid-i-fi-er"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"rigidifiers"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"The term 'rigidifier' is often used in engineering and materials science contexts to describe additives or components that enhance the stiffness or rigidity of a material or structure. It can refer to chemical substances, mechanical devices, or processes.","examples":[{"sentence":"Epoxy resins are often used as rigidifiers in composite materials.","translation":"エポキシ樹脂は、複合材料の硬化剤としてよく使用されます。"},{"sentence":"The addition of carbon fibers acts as a rigidifier, significantly increasing the strength of the plastic.","translation":"炭素繊維の添加は硬化剤として機能し、プラスチックの強度を大幅に向上させます。"}],"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"The rigidifier made the material completely inflexible, it shattered easily.","correct":"The rigidifier made the material very inflexible, but it was still susceptible to shattering under extreme stress.","note":"While a rigidifier increases stiffness, it doesn't necessarily make a material completely inflexible or immune to damage. Excessive rigidity can sometimes lead to brittleness."}]},"level_frequency":{"frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency - specialized vocabulary.","note":"This word is relatively uncommon in general usage but is more frequently encountered in technical or scientific contexts related to materials science, engineering, and construction."}}
